TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit CallbackBehaviorAttribute extends System.Attribute implements class System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior
Public NotInheritable Class CallbackBehaviorAttribute Inherits Attribute Implements IEndpointBehavior
public ref class CallbackBehaviorAttribute sealed : Attribute, System::ServiceModel::Description::IEndpointBehavior
type CallbackBehaviorAttribute = class inherit Attribute interface IEndpointBehavior

Docs.summary: Configures a callback service implementation in a client application.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute> attribute to configure or extend the execution behavior of a callback contract implementation in a client application. This attribute performs the same function for the callback class as the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceBehaviorAttribute> attribute with the exception of instancing behavior and transaction settings.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute> must be applied to the class that implements the callback contract. If applied to a non-duplex contract implementation an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception is thrown at runtime.
> [!NOTE] > You can also use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationBehaviorAttribute> attribute for the callback operation implementations. However, if <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationBehaviorAttribute> is used on a callback operation, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationBehaviorAttribute.ReleaseInstanceMode%2A> property must be <xref:System.ServiceModel.ReleaseInstanceMode.None> or an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception is thrown at runtime.
The following properties are available:
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.AutomaticSessionShutdown%2A> property automatically closes the session when the channel is closed and the callback has finished processing any remaining messages.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.ConcurrencyMode%2A> property controls the internal threading model, enabling support for reentrant or multithreaded callback objects.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.IgnoreExtensionDataObject%2A> property enables the runtime to ignore extra serialization information that is not required to process the message.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.IncludeExceptionDetailInFaults%2A> property specifies whether unhandled exceptions in a service are returned to the service as SOAP faults for debugging purposes.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.MaxItemsInObjectGraph%2A> property limits on the number of items in an object graph that are serialized.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.TransactionIsolationLevel%2A> property specifies the transaction isolation level that the contract supports.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.TransactionTimeout%2A> property specifies the time period within which a transaction must complete or it aborts.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.UseSynchronizationContext%2A> property indicates whether to synchronize inbound method calls automatically using the current <xref:System.Threading.SynchronizationContext> object.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.ValidateMustUnderstand%2A> property informs the system whether it should confirm that SOAP headers marked as `MustUnderstand` have, in fact, been understood.
## Examples The following code example shows a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute> on a callback object that uses the <xref:System.Threading.SynchronizationContext> object to determine which thread to marshal to, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.ValidateMustUnderstand%2A> property to enforce message validation, and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.IncludeExceptionDetailInFaults%2A> property to return exceptions as <xref:System.ServiceModel.FaultException> objects to the service for debugging purposes.
[!code-csharp[CallbackBehaviorAttribute#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/callbackbehaviorattribute/cs/client.cs#3)] [!code-vb[CallbackBehaviorAttribute#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/callbackbehaviorattribute/vb/client.vb#3)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default settings for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute> are:
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.AutomaticSessionShutdown%2A> property is `true`.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.ConcurrencyMode%2A> is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.ConcurrencyMode.Single>.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.IgnoreExtensionDataObject%2A> property is `false`.
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceBehaviorAttribute.IncludeExceptionDetailInFaults%2A> is `false`.
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.UseSynchronizationContext%2A> is `false`.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.ValidateMustUnderstand%2A> property is `true`.
## Examples The following code example shows a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute> on a callback object that uses the <xref:System.Threading.SynchronizationContext> object to determine which thread to marshal to, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.ValidateMustUnderstand%2A> property to enforce message validation, and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.IncludeExceptionDetailInFaults%2A> property to return exceptions as <xref:System.ServiceModel.FaultException> objects to the service for debugging purposes.
[!code-csharp[CallbackBehaviorAttribute#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/callbackbehaviorattribute/cs/client.cs#3)] [!code-vb[CallbackBehaviorAttribute#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/callbackbehaviorattribute/vb/client.vb#3)]

member this.AutomaticSessionShutdown : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Specifies whether to automatically close a session when a service closes a duplex session.
Docs.value: if duplex callback objects automatically close a session when the service closes a duplex session; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default, when a service closes a duplex session and the callback has finished processing any remaining messages, the callback closes the session. Setting <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.AutomaticSessionShutdown%2A> to `false` prevents the client from automatically closing the session.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool UseSynchronizationContext { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.UseSynchronizationContext : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to use the current synchronization context to choose the thread of execution.
Docs.value: if all calls to the service must run on the thread specified by the ; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to provide the user interface thread affinity that some applications require. For example, a Windows Forms application may be registered as a singleton service object. In this case, all calls into the service must run on the Windows Forms thread. The default case, in which <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceBehaviorAttribute.UseSynchronizationContext%2A> is set to `true`, synchronizes all calls to the service to run on the user interface thread.
Note that the thread used is the current synchronization thread when <xref:System.ServiceModel.DuplexChannelFactory%601.CreateChannel%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.DuplexClientBase%601.CreateChannel%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> is called. In the case of an Windows Forms application, this means that these calls should occur after a call to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.Run%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.
## Examples The following code example shows a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute> on a callback object that uses the <xref:System.Threading.SynchronizationContext> object to determine which thread to marshal to, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.ValidateMustUnderstand%2A> property to enforce message validation, and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.IncludeExceptionDetailInFaults%2A> property to return exceptions as <xref:System.ServiceModel.FaultException> objects to the service for debugging purposes.
[!code-csharp[CallbackBehaviorAttribute#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/callbackbehaviorattribute/cs/client.cs#3)] [!code-vb[CallbackBehaviorAttribute#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/callbackbehaviorattribute/vb/client.vb#3)]
